result.execSummary:
The defendant ALLISSON S PETERS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Eligible for Early release.
Concurrent with: any other sentence

Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

records.addlTxt:
11:22 AM Defendant ALLISSON S PETERS in court, in custody.  Attorney Laura Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brittany Van Rite in court for ALLISSON S PETERS. 
PLQ filed w/NC pleas.  Court reviews right to appear in person for PLEAS.  DE waives right.  Court accepts wavier.  ADA Nelson makes recommendation.  Atty Van Rite - joint recommendation, requests DE be  eligible for early release.  Court reviews rights, charges & penalties w/DE, accepts waiver, plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty.  Sentencing arguments.  DE addresses the Court.  
Court sentences DE:
Count1 - 
60 days jail, 
$250 fine plus costs.

Count 2 -
90 days jail concurrent w/Count , -2 days credit 
$250 fine plus costs, 
$250 DNA Surcharge & Sample.
DE is eligible for Early Release.
Appeal, firearms & voting rights given to DE.

Defendant is in DOC and arrangements were not made for her to appear. Atty. Van RIte would like to schedule a motion hearing. State will be filling motion asking Court to dismiss suppression motion.
Motion hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
